content.body:
> <@mhofman:matrix.org> Oh sure one doesn't prevent the other. But in general, I would be hopeful that frozen objects and frozen intrinsics should allow engines to do some optimizations instead of making things slower (as it seems to be the case currently). We hear stories of people liking hardened environments for the integrity guarantees, but being unhappy with the performance impact, which is a blocker for adoption in production in some cases.

Do you know of any concrete cases where frozen objects are slower than u frozen objects in V8? We investigated this 3 years ago and found nothing useful. Links to bugs or repros would be useful.
